meanings.definition: A small or insignificant creature, especially an insect or other arthropod.
meanings.sent1: The garden was full of tiny beasties crawling around.
meanings.sent2: I don't like when beasties like spiders come into the house.
meanings.sent3: The beasties in the grass seemed to be having a party.
meanings.sent4: The beasties under the rocks were like a hidden world.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the colorful beasties on the flowers.

meanings.sent1: The explorer was cautious of encountering fierce beasties in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The beasties in the zoo looked majestic but untamed.
meanings.sent3: The beasties in the forest roared loudly, scaring the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The beasties of the night prowled silently in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The beasties in the savannah moved gracefully, blending with the tall grass.

meanings.definition: A person who is cruel or uncivilized in behavior.
meanings.sent1: The villain in the story was portrayed as a heartless beastie.
meanings.sent2: The beastie of a boss made everyone fear coming to work.
meanings.sent3: The beastie at the party kept making rude comments to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The beastie of a neighbor never greeted anyone in the building.
meanings.sent5: The beastie of a customer yelled at the cashier for no reason.
